mdRecord.dcterms:description: Great Hall, concrete staircase with wrought-iron quatrefoils

Anderson House, was designed and built by Bernard Ralph Maybeck between 1931-1935. Maybeck's most spectacular interior on campus is contained in this large brick dormitory for women. It is a concrete great hall with an amazing set of trusses that includes his wife's monogram in Gothic letters. Also, the great hall uses bubblestone to lighten the weight of concrete in the valance and fireplace. Maybeck molds the fireplace bubblestone into imaginative flames. http://www.principia.edu/maybeck/build/anderson.htm [work]
